intro: Erigeron stapfianus, commonly known as the Stapf's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble clusters of small flowers. The plant typically features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, adapted to withstand dry conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with yellow centers, blooming during the warmer months. Erigeron stapfianus is often found in rocky soils and open habitats, thriving in environments with limited water availability.
